Graphics Software Development and Validation (GSDV) - Direct3D driver optimization for 9/10/11/12 - Silicon analysis and triage including development of automated flow for triage down to cluster unit  - Future silicon development - ISV enabling for Intel Integrated GraphicsVisual Computing Group (VCG), member of the Larrabee Direct3D software development team - Worked with ISVs to enable content on software rendering stack - Developed custom Direct3D content to support enabling and debug of software rendering pipeline - Debug of software rendering corruptions due to compiler or rasterization pipeline -  Direct3D driver development and optimization for Direct3D 9, 10, 11
Rich mobile content development for the Android and iPhone platforms.

Real Time Visualization & Simulation Team - Implemented cutting edge effects through the use of OpenGL and GLSL shading language - Visualization of metrics from data generated from a simulation environment - Interactive Theatre Air Defense Simulation

College Cyber Defenders  - Developed tools to monitor the vulnerabilities of on-site networks - Detection and counter attack of malicious network trafficInstitute of Scientific Computing Research - Designed and developed new interface for user interaction and control - Worked with large group of users through design process to scope both requirements and features

recommendations: Will Damon
at Apple Inc.
July 2, 2010, Will worked with Robert Blake in different groups

I worked with Blake in several capacities on the Larrabee project.  Blake's work is solid.  His attention to detail is impressive as is his understanding for developing good software for GPUs, CPUs and and other platform architectures.  He's quite capable of producing high quality code and documentation under tight schedules, too.  Blake is very quick to pick up on new technologies and always eager to learn about and try out the next great thing.  Finally, he has a great attitude, he's a team player, and he's fun to work with; he has certainly earned my respect and endorsement.

S Terry Brugger, PhD
Solutions Architect at Sqrrl and Part Time Professor at Capella University
June 5, 2010, S Terry managed Robert Blake directly

I was Blake's mentor for his senior Capstone project at NAU and co-mentor for his internship at LLNL. When people ask me how hard it is to mentor interns or note that they haven't had good experiences with interns, I relay that when you have a really good intern, you'll give them a task that you think will take them a month, and the next day they'll ask you, "What next?" Blake did this to us literally. He finished the entire project that we thought he'd only make a dent in, and had to be given a whole new project to work on. He is just a natural software engineer. I'm disappointed that between our budget cycle and his graduation schedule, we weren't able to bring him on full-time. I would be pleased to have Blake on my team any day.

I would not hesitate to hire him for a job for which he is nominally qualified.
